issue.title: One to one relationship shown as one to many in ERD after adding primary key in both tables
issue.body:
### Description

This problem is similar to issue https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/issues/21398, but i've added a primary key in both tables.



### DBeaver Version

23.2.3

### Operating System

mac os

### Database and driver

PostgreSQL 16.0

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create Database

```
CREATE TABLE person_phone (
id SERIAL PRIMARY key, 
phone text
);

CREATE TABLE person_email (
id SERIAL PRIMARY key,
person_phone_id INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE, 
email TEXT, 
FOREIGN KEY(person_phone_id) REFERENCES person_phone(id)
);

INSERT INTO person_phone (phone) VALUES ('aaa'), ('bbb'), ('ccc');
INSERT INTO person_email (person_phone_id,email) VALUES (1, 'test@test.com'), (2,'hello@hello.com');

```
2. Connect to DB

3. View ERD Diagram

4. Observe that the one-to-one relationship is displayed as one-to-many

![image](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/assets/98165959/750a9091-23b0-40f8-99f1-fa83ad53bb64)

5. Recreate DB by removing primary key from person_email table

```
CREATE TABLE person_phone (
id SERIAL PRIMARY key, 
phone text
);

CREATE TABLE person_email (
person_phone_id INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE, 
email TEXT, 
FOREIGN KEY(person_phone_id) REFERENCES person_phone(id)
);

INSERT INTO person_phone (phone) VALUES ('aaa'), ('bbb'), ('ccc');
INSERT INTO person_email (person_phone_id,email) VALUES (1, 'test@test.com'), (2,'hello@hello.com');

```
7. Refresh and reconnect to DB

9. View ERD diagram

10. Observer that the one-to-one relationship is displayed correctly

![image](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/assets/98165959/5da80358-8e90-493d-9544-0f0adc6dfc62)

issue.title: Prevent Dbeaver from closing output tabs automatically after CSV export?
issue.body:
### Description

I have 3 queries I need to run.

I would like to run all of them and export all of them to their own CSV.

DBeaver populates the results of the 3 queries in each of their own tab (great), however, after I export 1 of them, a tab automatically closes. How do I prevent this from happening?

### DBeaver Version

Dbeaver Community 23.1.4

### Operating System

_No response_

### Database and driver

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Option to view the SQL code of a (scheduled) BigQuery SQL query in dbeaver
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
No.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like to view the SQL code of (scheduled) queries from GBQ in dbeaver (shown with circles):
![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 12-57-10](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/assets/20364007/f05ba7c3-5052-49ce-8a2e-8137ceac19fb)
![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 12-56-23](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/assets/20364007/20783f21-7e5f-4b8e-98a9-6640c7434cf2)

When I "View Data" on these queries they are automatically executed. I would like another option to be able to also inspect the SQL code for this query.

Like in the "Details" tab on the GBQ web UI:

![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 12-59-12](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/assets/20364007/5f672dbb-8024-44b9-a3be-ea1635188c66)

comment.body:
> Could you please clarify if GBQ stands for Google Big Query?

Yes

issue.title: Poor Result Formatting of BigQuery Nested Objects
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for reporting an issue.

*IMPORTANT* -  *before* creating a new issue please look around:
 - DBeaver documentation: https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/wiki
 and
 - open issues in Github tracker: https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/issues
  
If you cannot find a similar problem, then create a new issue. Short tips about new issues can be found here: https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/wiki/Posting-issues

Please, do not create issue duplicates. If you find the same or similar issue, just add a comment or vote for this feature. It helps us to track the most popular requests and fix them faster.

Please fill in as much of the template as possible.
-->

#### System information: 
- Operating system (distribution) and version: macOS Monterey - 12.3.1 (21E258) 
- DBeaver version: 22.0.4.202205011839
- Additional extensions: 

#### Connection specification:
- Database name and version: Google Big Query
- Driver name: SimbaJDBCDriverforGoogleBigQuery42_1.2.22.1026
- Do you use tunnels or proxies (SSH, SOCKS, etc)? No

#### Describe the problem you're observing:

BigQuery has a datatype called STRUCT, which is essentially a key-value type. DBeaver does not display the key names, instead of using `..."f":..` as a stand-in for _all keys_. And similarly uses `..."v":...` to indicate values before displaying the value, which seems unnecessary and convoluted. It also might be reading those objects as strings (i.e., an "ABC" field).

![Screen Shot 2022-05-19 at 3 46 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16674499/169410730-7ba5e452-b4c1-45d1-8f9f-3711256cc13f.png)

Anyway, all this makes using the data more difficult. Not being able to see the keys means I have to use the web app to look up what keys are available. 

![Screen Shot 2022-05-19 at 3 54 58 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16674499/169411021-d70c39e0-a78a-4f51-9b3e-3d0670785b1c.png)

#### Steps to reproduce, if exist:

```sql
select 
	attributes
	, attributes.id
	, attributes.name
from bigquery-public-data.genomics_cannabis.cs10_gff
limit 100;
```

issue.title: Postgresql database backup does not includes "-T tablename" for unchecked tables in pg_dump command
issue.body:
### Description

In Tools/Backup, not checked tables (that I don't want to backup) is not cut off from backup.

To workaround my problem, I copied pg_dump command that dbeaver created and ran on terminal with aditional options -T table1 -T table2 ... 

### DBeaver Version

Community Edition 23.2.1.202309260508

### Operating System

Debian 12

### Database and driver

Postgresql 10

### Steps to reproduce

1. Select Tools / Backup on a Postgresql-10 database;
2. Check one or more schemas, and uncheck one or more tables from these schemas;
3. Advance, select Custom format and continue; 
4. Dbeaver shows the pg_dump command with options used and start backup. 
5. Restore the database in other place and see that the tables you have unchecked was part of backup.

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: Maybe this is the case for multiple schemas: https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/issues/21669

issue.title: postgres: gist exclusion constraint: DDL fail
issue.body:
### Description

I'm using Postgres Exclusion Constraints, see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/ddl-constraints.html#DDL-CONSTRAINTS-EXCLUSION.


The DBeaver Table DDL tells me something like
```sql
CREATE INDEX i ON t USING gist (a);
```

... but the reality is (and pg_dump tells me):
```sql
ALTER TABLE ONLY t
    ADD CONSTRAINT i EXCLUDE USING gist (a WITH &&);
```

The gist exclusion constraint operators are missing.


### DBeaver Version

CE 23.1.5

### Operating System

Windows 10

### Database and driver

PostgreSQL 15.4
Driver 42.5.2

### Steps to reproduce

```sql
CREATE TABLE t (
	a daterange NOT NULL
);

ALTER TABLE ONLY t
    ADD CONSTRAINT i EXCLUDE USING gist (a WITH &&);
```

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Oracle ORA-01460 "ORA-01460: unimplemented or unreasonable conversion requested"
issue.body:
### Description

Unable to get the table definition from a Oracle 9i database


### DBeaver Version

Coomunity Edition 23.2.2.202310081633

### Operating System

Windows 11

### Database and driver

Connected to Oracle 9i Database 9.2.0.1.0 with oracle_thin driver
The database language is Italian.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Expand the connection node;
2. Expand "Schemas";
3. Expand one schema;
4. Expan tables: getting a first error message saying:
5. "SQL Error [1460] [72000]: ORA-01460: conversione richiesta non implementata o irrazionale
"  Error : 1460, Position : 45, Sql = SELECT 
c.*,c.TABLE_NAME as OBJECT_NAME FROM ALL_TAB_COLS c
WHERE c.OWNER=:1  AND c.TABLE_NAME=:2 , OriginalSql = SELECT 
c.*,c.TABLE_NAME as OBJECT_NAME FROM ALL_TAB_COLS c
WHERE c.OWNER=? AND c.TABLE_NAME=?, Error Msg = ORA-01460: conversione richiesta non implementata o irrazionale
ORA-01460: conversione richiesta non implementata o irrazionale"

In English the translation of the error is "unimplemented or unreasonable conversion requested",

6. Let's go on activating the node of a table;
7. Activate the context menu and hit "Generate SQL" -> "DDL";
8. Again the same error comes up:
"Error running DDL generation
SQL Error [1460] [72000]: ORA-01460: conversione richiesta non implementata o irrazionale"
9. Of course no DDL code will follow.

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Export DDL for many objects
issue.body:
Hi,
I'd like to be able to export DDL for many objects, each object to his own file.
Currently I'm able to select them in Database Navigator and use Generate SQL -> DDL from context menu.
This however allows me to copy to clipboard a single script containing all objects; a nice feature would be to be able, through some other means, to be able to export ddl to separate files in a directory of my choosing.
This applies to all objects for which DDL is available (tables, views, procedures, etc) and to all databases. 

For tables, the export wizard should allow to choose DDL options (Full DDL, no storage information, Compact form), however this might be a separate request.

comment.body: +1 I'd love this feature for backup my procedures on github
